title: Part A: Thesis
stimulusHtml:
The thesis may appear anywhere within the essay.

A thesis that meets the criteria can be awarded the point whether or not the rest of the response successfully conveys that line of reasoning.
descriptions: The response demonstrates any of the following:
The response responds to the prompt with a defensible thesis that may establish a line of reasoning.

title: Part B:  Evidence and Commentary
stimulusHtml: Writing that suffers from grammatical and/or mechanical errors that interfere with communication cannot earn the fourth point in this row.

title: Part C:  Sophistication
stimulusHtml: This point should be awarded only if the demonstration of sophistication or complex understanding is part of the argument, not merely a phrase or reference.
descriptions: Response does not demonstrate sophistication of thought and/or a complex understanding of the rhetorical situation.
Response demonstrates sophistication of thought and/or a complex understanding of the rhetorical situation.
